channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Cloud Private
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Cloud Private

item.title: CVE-2018-1943|2024-08-05T04:14:39.336Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.0 and 3.1.1 is vulnerable to HTTP HOST header injection, caused by improper validation of input. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary HTTP headers, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including cross-site scripting, cache poisoning or session hijacking. IBM X-Force ID: 153385.

item.title: CVE-2018-1938|2024-08-05T04:14:39.591Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.1 could alllow a local user with administrator privileges to intercept highly sensitive unencrypted data. IBM X-Force ID: 153318.

item.title: CVE-2018-1843|2024-08-05T04:14:38.468Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: The Identity and Access Management (IAM) services (IBM Cloud Private 3.1.0) do not use a secure channel, such as SSL, to exchange information only when accessed internally from within the cluster. It could be possible for an attacker with access to network traffic to sniff packets from the connection and uncover data. IBM X-Force ID: 150903

item.title: CVE-2018-1939|2024-08-05T04:14:39.440Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.1 could allow a remote attacker to conduct phishing attacks, using an open redirect attack. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to spoof the URL displayed to redirect a user to a malicious Web site that would appear to be trusted. This could allow the attacker to obtain highly sensitive information or conduct further attacks against the victim. IBM X-Force ID: 153319.

item.title: CVE-2018-1841|2024-08-05T04:14:38.567Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 2.1.0 could allow a local user to obtain the CA Private Key due to it being world readable in boot/master node. IBM X-Force ID: 150901.

item.title: CVE-2018-1937|2024-08-05T04:14:39.562Z -- ibm -- cloud%20private
item.description: IBM Cloud Private 3.1.1 could alllow a local user with administrator privileges to intercept highly sensitive unencrypted data. IBM X-Force ID: 153317.
